image.altText: A three storey house sits on top of someone else's yard.

props.synopsis: A McCrae resident evacuated on Tuesday after his house was impacted by a landslide has called for the issue to be fixed, as works continue to make the site safe for people to return.

title.children: Residents call for a solution after Mornington Peninsula landslide

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and wearing a dark top holds a sign behind a window that says "open".

props.synopsis: Halls Gap is dependent on tourism and some businesses have lost more than a third of their income, but many don't qualify for government support.

title.children: Grampians businesses fear closures as they wait for government grants

image.altText: A man with mud on his face in the forrest.

props.synopsis: Foreign minister Penny Wong warns Russia that all diplomatic options "are on the table" as officials scramble to verify reports that Australian man Oscar Jenkins has been killed in Ukraine.

title.children: Wong warns Russia over reports captured Australian killed in Ukraine

image.altText: Giant yellow AO sign in front of white tessellated building, with crowds in the distance to left of frame.

props.synopsis: With more than 1 million people expected to walk through the gates this year, how affordable do punters reckon it is to head to the Australian Open?

title.children: How affordable are fans finding the Australian Open?

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka smiles and greets the crowd after her win

props.synopsis: Round two gets underway at the Australian Open today and features an all star cast of Aryna Sabalenka, Novak Djokovic, Coco Gauff and Alexander Zverev. Follow live.

title.children: Sabalenka and Djokovic headline day four as round two of Australian Open begins

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sabalenka looks comfrotable as she steps on court

image.altText: Bush alight with fire at night time with smoke in the air

props.synopsis: One in 10 homes across Australia will be considered uninsurable within the next decade, according to climate change risk analysis modelling.

title.children: Rate of uninsurable Australian homes increases amid natural disasters

image.altText: GettyImages-2193822291

props.synopsis: Rising Australian star Alexei Popyrin says he has some thinking to do after a disappointing exit from his home grand slam.

title.children: Popyrin bemoans 'shocking' Australian Open exit after tough month

image.altText: Alex de Minaur pumps his fist in celebration

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur has been Australia's great men's grand slam hope for a few years now. Never has he looked more ready to step to the plate.

title.children: De Minaur says 'motivation has never been higher' after perfect start

image.altText: A woman in a white tshirt looks at a computer with her colleague. They are both smiling

props.synopsis: Some Victorian neighbourhood centres may be forced to reduce their programs or even close as they grapple with rising costs, debt, and demand.

title.children: Neighbourhood Houses face rising debts as bushfire funding dries up

image.altText: A number of police stand around at a river.

props.synopsis: A person who was at the popular swimming location said he saw the man calling out for help from the water before he disappeared, but he was unable to find him during an extensive search.

title.children: Emergency services search for man missing in Murray River at Mildura

image.altText: A female in summer dress and ponytail stands next to daughter, 6 and son, 8, sitting at top of slide

props.synopsis: Families are facing crippling costs to educate their kids — even at public schools. It has led some to withdraw their children from hobbies and plan carefully simply to get them through school.

title.children: Parents turn to credit, grandparents in face of rising education costs

image.altText: An elderly woman with white wavy hair and glasses wears a blue dress with a white flower on her lapel and sits in a home.

props.synopsis: Police are renewing their calls for help to find a man who attacked an elderly widow in her Melbourne home twice in two years.

title.children: Fresh plea to help solve cold-case Melbourne sex assaults

image.altText: A close up photo of a couple. The man has grey hair and a grey beard and the woman has long brown hair and glasses.

props.synopsis: Stuart and Vikki Guy say they had recently cancelled the contents insurance on their home after their total home and contents bill went from $1,800 to $6,000.

title.children: Couple who ditched contents insurance after shock bill lose house in fire

image.altText: Wangaratta car fire CCTV

props.synopsis: Police release CCTV showing two alleged burglars setting themselves alight after pouring liquid on the ground next to a parked car.

title.children: Alleged burglars run from scene with clothes on fire, CCTV shows

image.altText: Firebombing plane drops fire retardant on a fire

props.synopsis: Firefighting aircraft have been soaring through the skies over Los Angeles in recent days as fires have ravaged the city. When it comes to disasters of its own, Australia has about 500 aircraft it can call on.

title.children: Inside Australia's 'massive investment' in aerial firefighting

image.altText: Courtney Mills performing as a DJ.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne DJ is being remembered as a "sparkling" and "joyful" person after her death in Bali on Sunday.

title.children: Family remembers 'magnificent' Melbourne woman after Bali death

image.altText: Lino Atem wears a basketball top and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A father from Melbourne's south-west is calling for justice for his two sons, who have been killed in separate incidents.

title.children: Melbourne father wants answers after two sons killed in separate attacks

image.altText: A portrait photo of Gaye Martin smiling at her home

props.synopsis: In Melbourne's outer suburbs, social isolation can be an issue, but dedicated community members are doing their best to help residents stay connected through volunteer-run events like a weekly coffee club.

title.children: This Melbourne retiree is doing her best to tackle loneliness

image.altText: Two police cars are parked in the middle of a street which is taped off with police tape.

props.synopsis: Police allege a man was slashed across the head with a machete after he was approached by two people who demanded his car keys.

title.children: Police charge 15yo boy over alleged St Kilda machete attack

image.altText: Julian Leeser Liberal MP for Berowra stands outdoors and looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Julian Leeser has called for mandatory jail sentences for people convicted of vandalising synagogues following a string of incidents across Australia.

title.children: Federal MP calls for mandatory jail sentences for synagogue vandalism

image.altText: Man with long grey hair in a pony tail and a red work shirt sits in outdoor area of his home with his hands in his lap

props.synopsis: The average out-of-pocket cost for a GP visit has risen by 4.1 per cent nationally over the past year, with patients in Tasmania, the ACT and NSW paying the most.

title.children: Australians put off visiting a GP amid rising out-of-pocket costs

image.altText: A woman looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Consumers have accused Melbourne beauty store Botanifique of aggressive sales tactics that led to them to spending hundreds or thousands of dollars on products.

title.children: Why a purchase from a beauty shop left Katherine 'breaking down'

image.altText: A black and white photo of Alan wearing a suit and glases and sitting in a photo booth with his hands clasped looking down.

props.synopsis: Alan Adler spent nearly half a century maintaining the iconic photo booth outside Flinders Street Station in Melbourne's CBD.

title.children: After 50 years, Melbourne says goodbye to iconic photo booth operator

image.altText: Concept art showing interior of sports stadium with cricket match underway.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff has spoken for the first time since a report by an independent economist found the Hobart stadium's construction timeline was unrealistic and costs "significantly understated".

title.children: AFL-imposed deadlines 'a challenge' for Hobart stadium, premier says

image.altText: two people on a factory floor.

props.synopsis: Australia has a wealth of coal and gas resources as well as renewable energy, so why are energy costs so high — especially for manufacturers?

title.children: 'Obscenely expensive' wholesale gas prices driving manufacturing offshore

image.altText: Large wind turbines stand in the ocean. No land is in sight, the wind turbines continue to the horizon.

props.synopsis: Any plans for turbines off the South Australian coast are gone, for now. But as the federal election looms, offshore wind will play a key role in Labor's renewable energy plan.

title.children: SA is a leader in renewable energy, but it said no to offshore wind

image.altText: Portrait of writer and comedian Sashi Perera wearing a long shirt dress that is pale purple, with a green skirt.

props.synopsis: Leaving my day job was the only way to circuit break my life back into balance. Six months later, life is very different.

title.children: My father died shortly after he retired. It changed my outlook on work

image.altText: A black ute on a trailer

props.synopsis: Police have seized a Holden Commodore believed to have been involved in a hit-and-run that critically injured a four-year-old boy on the Victorian–NSW border.

title.children: Car seized as police investigate hit-and-run that injured 4yo boy

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell waves his bat towards the crowd while playing for the Stars

props.synopsis: After belting a typically incredible 90 from 52 balls for the Melbourne Stars, Glenn Maxwell concedes he would have made the same call as Australian selectors in opting for youth when picking the Sri Lanka tour squad.

title.children: Fresh from another BBL classic, Maxwell harbours no grudge for Test snub

image.altText: A group of women dancing

props.synopsis: Bev Vinge has been teaching line dancing on the Victorian/New South Wales border for more than three decades.

title.children: 87yo line dancer notches up 30 years of bootscooting on the border

image.altText: a man in a camo uniform holds two transparent plastic bags

props.synopsis: A soldier's brainwave has the potential to help provide a cheap, easy-to-replicate solution to the global IV fluids crisis, and other army personnel are being encouraged to get creative too.

title.children: 'Creative outlet' for soldiers producing game-changing inventions

image.altText: A man wearing a snorkel in the ocean, holding kelp

props.synopsis: Kelp forests decimated by sea urchins are being replanted in Port Phillip Bay in an attempt to rebuild the ecosystem.

title.children: Kelp is changing the seafloor in Melbourne from a desert to a forest

image.altText: Older man in suit talking at an outdoor press conference in Werribee

props.synopsis: Long-time Werribee local Steve Murphy says it's an honour to be selected by the Liberal party as its candidate for a by-election next month.

title.children: Liberals unveil candidate for by-election in former Victorian treasurer's seat

image.altText: A cross country skier approaching a cleared asphalt road

props.synopsis: A permit to allow snow-clearing along a section of the Bogong High Plains Road to accommodate a new cafe could put a world series ski marathon and Winter Olympic qualifying events at risk.

title.children: Snow-clearing for cafe to impact world series cross-country ski marathon

image.altText: Hadi Nazari was reported missing in the Kosciuszko National Park on Boxing Day

props.synopsis: After receiving treatment for dehydration, Hadi Nazari has now been discharged from Cooma Hospital, NSW Health officials confirmed.

title.children: Hiker Hadi Nazari discharged from hospital
